Description: Body sherd (mended from three fragments with added plaster) of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery heavy chalice with part of cul; discoloured white slip; interior: glazed streaky black with faded decoration in added colour; above, part of rosette in white outline and red dots with two white bands below; two white bands near bottom of sherd; exterior: painted decoration consisting of lion attacking fallen bull (forepart of bull to right with neck and head in dilute outline; head on ground and foreleg folded under body, facing lion, head, neck and front paw in outline; row of dots on underbelly); elaborate rosettes as filling ornament; row of single dots above double guilloche pattern on cul.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as coming from a heavy chalice belonging to the Group of Elaborate Animal Chalices. Chalices that fall into this group are usually large and heavy-walled and are also known as chalice-kraters. Chalices in this group display elaborate compositions that include polychromy and delicately painted figures (Lemos 1991, 90-1).
